<table border="0" width="100%"> <tbody> <tr> <td align="left"> <p> The WorldInfo defines the title of the scene and can hold additional metadata. </p> <p> After you've created a great world, sign it! You can provide a title and a description embedded within the file by using a WorldInfo node. The title field provides the name for your world so that the browser can show it. The info field can hold any additional information of interest. </p> <p> These X3D scenes are adapted directly from the <a href="http://www.wiley.com/legacy/compbooks/vrml2sbk/toc/ch29.htm" target="_Vrml2Sourcebook">original VRML 2.0 Sourcebook chapter examples</a>. Also available: <a href="http://www.sdsc.edu/~moreland/courses/Siggraph98/vrml97/slides/mt0491.htm" target="_Vrml2SourcebookCourse">Introduction to VRML97 SIGGRAPH98 course notes</a>. </p> </td> <td align="center" rowspan="2"> <a href="index.html"><img border="0" alt="Figure 29.1 World Info: view image to see browser title" title="Figure 29.1 World Info: view image to see browser title" hspace="10" src="Figure29_1WorldInfo.png" width="156" height="89" align="middle"/></a> </td> </tr> </tbody> </table>
